sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukrainians returning to Irpin and Kharkiv face the daunting task of rebuilding after continued Russian shelling leave the cities in ruins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Preparations are underway for the first in-person World Economic Forum in more than two years, as world leaders make their way to the Swiss mountain village of Davos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Spain is feeling the heat as temperatures soar to up to 15 degrees above average for the season, putting May on track to becoming the hottest month of the century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Football favourite Kylian Mbappe is set to continue at Paris Saint-Germain after French and international media outlets announce his extension.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's been three months since the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine and the city

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: of Irpin is in ruins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: According to local authorities, fighting and shelling has destroyed two-thirds of the buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The damage is estimated to be over 1.2 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky thanked the US for their financial support to his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I am grateful to President Joe Biden for immediately signing the 37 billion euro support package for Ukraine approved by Congress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is a historic contribution to the protection of freedom in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In the Kherson region, Russian troops guard the Kharkovka hydroelectric station, a power plant next to the Dnieper River.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Pro-Russian Ukrainian officials claim their presence has protected the plant from looting and possible sabotage, and that Crimea has been reconnected to a water supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The situation in Donbass is extremely difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As in previous days, the Russian army is trying to attack Slovyansk and Severodonetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The armed forces of Ukraine are restraining this offensive every day, and our defenders are repelling these offensive plans of Russia disrupting them and this is a concrete contribution to the approach of the main day the coveted day we all look forward to and fight for Victory Day meanwhile some residents of Harkiv say they're eager to come home, the uncertainty of the fighting and the risks of renewed shelling gives families with young children pause.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, for us older people, we want to return to our houses for the simple reason we can leave if they hit us again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But there are many families with young children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: One, two or five people in the same apartment and they have no place to stay if they shell again. They can hardly return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In May, Ukrainian forces pushed back Russian troops to the north and east despite constant shelling. In the face of the destruction, residents faced the daunting task of rebuilding their lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The world's top leaders from politics, civil society, media and the arts are making their way to the Swiss mountain village of Davos for the first in-person World Economic Forum in more than two years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Two thousand five hundred delegates will strive to find solutions to the world's most urgent challenges such as the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The forum founder says it's happening at the most consequential geopolitical and geo-economic time since its creation, against the backdrop of a once-in-a-century pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: UN climate summit, COP26, the One Trillion Trees project and many more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While the war will overshadow the meeting, the forum will also have panels on everything from climate change to gender inequality, football and the metaverse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Although this year's meeting will be lacking some of the star power of the past, including Chinese President Xi Jinping, who spoke at a virtual forum in January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Monkeypox is being detected worldwide, with health care officials having reported

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: around 80 cases of the disease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And the World Health Organization has reported another 50 suspected infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On Friday, France, Germany, Belgium and Australia joined the growing list of countries with confirmed cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The monkeypox virus is considered to have moderate transmissibility among humans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The likelihood of further spread of the virus through close contact, for example through sexual activities, is considered to be high. The viral disease is fatal for about one in ten people, according to the World Health Organization, and there are ways to treat the illness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: People exposed to the virus are often given one of several smallpox vaccines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And antiviral drugs are also being developed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is a drug that was developed under sponsorship with the U.S. government primarily to be stockpiled for use against smallpox should it ever recur or be used as a bioweapon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The particular drug, however, works against a whole family of viruses, smallpox, vaccinia, cowpox, and notably monkeypox.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's been approved for treatment of smallpox in the US under the name T-pox, and it's recently approved in the EMA for treatment of all orthopoxviruses that include monkeypox.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I'm very optimistic this is going to be an effective drug. There have been previous outbreaks of the virus in other regions, such as West and Central Africa. And in Nigeria, around 3,000 cases are reported a year, mostly in rural areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Spain is feeling the heat after temperatures soar, reaching up to 15 degrees above average for the season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With some areas reaching a scorching 44 degrees Celsius on Saturday, this unprecedented heat wave could make May the hottest month of the century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is estimated that about 2,000 people a year die in Spain due to excessive heat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Scientists warn that heat waves could become much more common and intense globally in the years to come due to the impact of the climate crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Spanish Meteorology Agency says the climates of North Africa are moving towards the south of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This means that by the middle of the century, longer and more intense periods of drought and of course higher temperatures will be more frequent for example the summers in a relatively cool Spanish city such as the Coru√±a could be similar to the climate of the Moroccan city of Casablanca the Spanish government has issued extreme heat warnings in several areas of the country advising all to stay hydrated, limit physical activity and to stay in cool areas whenever possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Migrants at the Mexican border cannot enter the United States without a visa, even to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: claim asylum. This comes as a U.S. judge reinstated a soon-to-expire COVID-19 ruling imposed by former President Donald Trump after Republican governors from more than 20 states demanded it continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Doctors Without Borders say the policy has led to overcrowding at border camps and that there is no access to shelter or services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A moment of protest on the red carpet at Cannes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: During a premiere, an unidentified woman tore off her clothes to reveal the message, Stop Raping us, scrawled across her body.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The message was written on the colors of the Ukrainian flag, referencing suspected war crimes committed by Russian forces since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A crowd of people with Danish flags and music welcomed Queen Margrethe of Denmark

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: as she arrived at Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens to celebrate 50 years on the throne.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The celebration was originally going to take place on January 14th, but it was postponed because of COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Plans for the celebration were primarily shaped around the Queen's love for ballet, music and art. 36 goals this season stays. Months of negotiations with Real Madrid failed to secure the three-time consecutive winner of the League One Player of the Year award, a contract with the Spanish side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But French and Spanish media sources both say the forward will announce extension on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Olympic Lyon beat Barcelona to win the Champions League finals, putting it on top of European women's football. It is the eighth time the team has won the title, beating Barcelona 3-1. Lyon also won the Champions League in 2020, but the match also marks a historic moment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sonia Bonpaster is the first woman to win the Champions as both a player and a coach. She was part of the team that won the trophy in both 2011 and 2012.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: All three of Lyon's goals were scored in the first 35 minutes of the match, taking the cup back from Barcelona, which won it last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A landmark moment for commercial space travel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: For the first time, American aerospace giant Boeing has docked a capsule named Starliner to the International Space Station.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Elon Musk's company, SpaceX, achieved the same feat three years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The successful trip marks another step down NASA's plan to have competing U.S. companies fly crew capsules to the station. On board Boeing's capsule was a dummy named Rosie the Rocketeer, named after World War II's Rosie the Riveter. The next step for the company is to run another test, but for the second round the capsule will have to successfully dock with a crew on board.
